channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Northport-Auckland freight: Almost one-in-five trucks found unroadworthy
item.description: Police checks result in 11 trucks being taken off the road completely after being considered a serious risk to public safety.

item.title: New Zealand nurse dies in England after contracting Covid-19
item.description: Barclay Mason's death has been confirmed by the Princess Alexandra hospital in the town of Harlow in Essex.

item.title: Hundreds gather for America's Cup World Series regatta opening
item.description: After a long and at times uncertain lead up, the America's Cup World Series regatta starts this week with four teams competing for their chance to race for sailing's most coveted trophy.

item.title: Covid-19: Ministry outlines resurgence plan in case of summer outbreak
item.description: New Zealanders need to be prepared to stay put if caught up in Covid-19 outbreak over summer, but ready to return home if outbreak has spread widely, the government says.

item.title: Fenz facing $12m deficit due to Covid-19
item.description: Fire and Emergency says Covid-19 cost it lost revenue of $42 million, some 7 percent of its income.

item.title: Appeal for witnesses to fatal helicopter crash
item.description: Air crash investigators are appealing for witnesses to this afternoon's fatal helicopter accident near Kaikōura.

item.title: 'I've got to show them what I can do' says University of Canterbury's first Dr of Education
item.description: The University of Canterbury's first Doctor of Education has graduated saying he wants to be a good role model for his children.

item.title: Work begins on massive $250m Ōhakea Air Base aircaft hangar
item.description: The complex defence construction project will house the new P-8A Poseidon fleet and bring about 250 personnel to the base from Auckland.

item.title: Man questioned over message left outside Christchurch mosque
item.description: Police have spoken to a 36-year-old man in relation to hate speech being left outside Al Noor mosque in Christchurch.

item.title: Crews fighting blaze on Christchurch's Port Hills
item.description: Emergency services have contained a scrub fire on Christchurch's Port Hills this afternoon.

item.title: Police seeking more powers to confront terror threat
item.description: In the briefing for the new Police Minister, police say their immediate priority is the first set of amendments to New Zealand's counter-terrorism legislation.

item.title: Christchurch house gas explosion: Gasfitter ordered to pay over $134k
item.description: A gasfitter charged after carrying out work at a Christchurch home a day before it exploded has been ordered to pay over $134,000 in emotional harm payments.

item.title: Cancer detection dog Levi’s hit rate nothing to sniff at
item.description: The University of Otago's youngest medical student has passed his first course with flying colours.

item.title: Call for Oranga Tamariki boss Grainne Moss 'to be gracious and leave'
item.description: Dame Tariana Turia says Oranga Tamariki chief executive Grainne Moss should step aside and make way for Māori leadership.

item.title: Gunshots at Invercargill house unsettles community - police
item.description: Invercargill Police are appealing for information after at least five gunshots were heard at a residential property last night.

item.title: Number of children living in poverty likely to rise because of Covid-19
item.description: The economic downturn is likely to plunge more families into hardship despite actions taken by the government in response to Covid-19, an official briefing says.

item.title: Milestone in work to restore transport route through Kaikōura
item.description: Government, iwi and transport officials mark the departure of the alliance set up to steer the Kaikōura road and rail repair project.

item.title: Trans-Tasman bubble to help reunify families, business - Melbourne University epidemiologist
item.description: An epidemiologist at the University of Melbourne says because each Australian state has slightly different rules, a travel bubble can get complicated.
